intro: Utricularia monanthos, commonly known as the single-flowered bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is a small aquatic plant that typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater habitats. The plant is characterized by its simple, branching stems and small, delicate leaves that often have bladders used to trap prey. Its flowers are usually unisexual, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. Utricularia monanthos is native to parts of Africa and is known for its unique adaptations to nutrient-poor aquatic environments.
